Author: kolo#1111
Content: It‚Äôs a he.net dns server and NN ip s

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I didn't realize KMD diverged this much in how DNS seeds work, in production. Good to know

Author: kolo#1111
Content: We can have both static list (due to having NN network it‚Äôs easy) and crawler seeds. Later is outside of NN scope, just nodes crawler

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: SAFE forked the old hush-seeder, i guess i will look at their code to see what they did. it makes sense why they forked the old hush-seeder, if no komodo-seeder existed

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: hush-seeder was forked from zcash-seeder, so that is how most BTC/ZEC coins do things, just inherited from btc core

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's not wrong to do something different, i just didn't know

Author: kolo#1111
Content: It is bc of notary nodes. They don‚Äôt have permanent network of known nodes like we do so they need crawler/seeder.

Author: kolo#1111
Content: I believe NN will seed hush also well, shouldn‚Äôt be a problem as long as HUSH won‚Äôt crash so often

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @kolo yes, it would be nice if HUSH would crash less often

Author: kolo#1111
Content: I mean changing DNS seeds won‚Äôt solve this üòï

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @kolo hush will be running it's own actual DNS seeds soon and that will help the situation greatly. If you are talking about the core KMD bug that made hushd coredump at block 99973, that has been fixed

Author: phm87#7395
Content:
I have a very weird behavior about chips and dpow, I don't know if anybody have the same problem. I though it was due to my apow changes but I had the problems on new fresh nodes synced without apow. Do you know why notarized count is way below the blocks count ?
```  "chain": "main",
  "blocks": 4876620,
  "headers": 4876620,
  "bestblockhash": "000000000000be8271f683e86e00ed0c2670a0e9ea585a6c80a8425e75514bb7",
  "notarizedhash": "000000000001094bc5a31d3462084e7e3dad049fb43c838bf535e4f21d5aceca",
  "notarizedtxid": "2364cdf9a9fcfcdadf71934eee40e05b444bb2aa86f9ef5b5d1817df0482e020",
  "notarized": 4173500,
  "prevMoMheight": 4173500,``` 700k blocks is not nothing. I tried to reindex, delete notarizations file and restart but it didn't help. I deleted the whole content of .chips folder (except wallet.dat and chips.conf) but I had the same result. btw, I don't have this behavior of my NN Chips node nor on some on my test nodes
Do you have any idea why I have this behavior ?

Author: phm87#7395
Content:
<https://github.com/phm87/chips3/blob/apow/src/komodo_validation015.h#L82>
``static const int32_t KMD_SEASON_HEIGHTS[NUM_KMD_SEASONS] = {0, 4173578, 999999999};``
I think that 4173500 is the last nota of season2. I don't know why a fresh sync doesn't take into account s3 notas

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: May seem obvious, but have you updated Komodo?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: @phm87  that is correct... its a little unintuitive yes... The height/timestamp is when a season ends... That is why the third one is set years into the future.

Author: phm87#7395
Content:
@NutellaLicka  sorry I am not very clear : I synced a new chips node with jl777/chips3 repo (master branch). There is no komodo running here. I don't know why my getinfo differs from the normal behavior. My issue is not a my NN
@blackjok3r  yes I agree. As 4173578 was the end of season 2, I wonder why the notarized field 4173500 in my getinfo is the last block notarized by s2. Maybe it is a special case for initial download

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: shouldnt be the case.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Is it running with or witout txindex=1?

Content: txindex and reindex will fix it üôÇ

Content: shouldnt be all of them no.. The wallet code in them all is diffrent... Some work fine, CHIPS did, so maybe its a bug. A few others I remever run txindex aby defualt like KMD, so didnt need the watchonly path for notary keys.

Thank you again for your help

Author: phm87#7395
Content: as I have troubles with reindex, I'll try to delete blockchain and download it again with txindex enabled. I had troubles in the past, with reindex to change txindex from 0 to 1 (I was never able to do it on Chips). With a fresh sync with txindex, it should work

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @phm87 never reindex after changing txindex setting

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: always delete the datadir

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and you are welcome for saving you hundreds of hours of pain üôÇ

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: reindex + txindex changing does not work reliably all the time, just txindex changing doesn't work reliably all the time. If you change the setting of txindex, delete the datadir

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: yes, there is code to deal with this stuff, and if you want to find the bugs lurking there, be our guest

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: is this true for all BTC forks or just KMD? @dukeleto

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @gcharang it's hard to say exactly which versions of which forks have it. BTC core does not have this problem, but I am not sure if it's a bug in all/most zcash forks or a kmd-specific bug

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: got it. I was wondering if it was caused by our particular reliance on txindex for dPoW

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: dpow does not rely on txindex=1

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: then, why do all smart chains have txindex=1 in their confs by default?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: CC needs txindex

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: rewards needs txindex

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: dpow needs txindex for efficient method, external chains have implemented txindex=0 support for this, but since txindex is always there for komodo chains, it uses the more efficient method

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
got it. 
> efficiency

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: It would be possible to make txindex=0 work on smart chains without CCs and still have dpow, but nobody has wanted to do that, I guess

Author: phm87#7395
Content:
Sorry for the late reply. I have no pb with txindex=1. Joker explained me that the bug related to txindex=0 on chips is fixed on gamecredits. I will create an issue on github with the infos.
So now I test apow only with txindex set

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: its more an unimplemented feature than a bug

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: yes, allowing txindex=0 on a 3rd party coin with DPoW did not exist at first, and then the method of watching all 64 notary node addresses was implemented by James. When talking with potential new DPoW coins, one of the first things I ask them is if txindex=1 by default in their coin, or if they support it. GIN, for instance, requires txindex=1, so I didn't implement the txindex=0 codepath in GIN. It saves time in integrating the code as well as testing full syncs

Author: eclips#1570
Content: Someone tried to use an HSM with Komodo notary ?

Author: phm87#7395
Content:
now, iguana is uging signrawtransaction rpc calls. So whatever we put something into an HSM, if an attacker can take control of the notary node, if attacker can use signrawtransaction, he can sign any tx he wants. I don't think that HSM allows such rpc calls. I think that many huges deep changes into iguana should be performed to be able to use an HSM into Komodo notary. We can give a try later (if jl and ledger or trezor agree)
https://discordapp.com/channels/412898016371015680/456828345871761408/595653597660971009
